result.execSummary:
The defendant Dereian T Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reporter Paige Reardon. Defendant Dereian T Brown in court.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Dereian T Brown.  Attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1. Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty.

[Jaime D.]
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court reporter Meredith Seymour. Defendant Dereian T Brown not in court.  Attorney Tess Lewandowski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Dereian T Brown. DE did not appear or contact the court. State requests a body only warrant. Atty Anderson objects, waives argument. Court will issue a body only bench warrant.
Parties have reached an agreement and request plea/sentencing dates. DE given notice in hand for next hearing.

records.addlTxt: from the Court RE how to obtain an appointed attorney
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Erik M or Alexander M. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 0-100 block of N Butler St in Madison. 
Trial Judge - Br 17 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:10 AM Defendant appeared.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.
